Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2014 12:02PM readeram wrote: I have been on Xgeva for over a year and never thought I had any side effects but just last year I started having dental problems. Had to have 1 back molar removed. The dentist was going to do a root canal and crown but saw that the wisdom tooth was coming in (at age 59 I'm finally getting some wisdom) so he went ahead and removed it. Then just 2 months later needed another root canal. I thought is was due to the lower white blood cell count that I was getting these infections but after reading all of this it may be due to the Xgeva. I was getting the shots every 4 weeks but now I'm at every 6 weeks.
Posts.Title: Xgeva users - step up naturegirl2 Suesbooby2

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2007 11:49PM readeram wrote: Thanks for all your input. I'm seeing the general surgeon tomorrow and letting him know that I'm going to see the PS before I get the mastectomy so I can decide if I want breast reconstruction or not.Shouldn't be a problem getting a PS since I live in the Valley of Los Angeles. Madalyn, I have one drain in now from the 3rd surgery and no said I couldn't drive and have been driving since the day after the surgery. It's no fun going around with this pouch but I'm wearing pants with pockets and stick it in the pocket.
Posts.Title: Simple Mastectomy - Anyone had one? readeram petelzmom

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2014 11:31AM readeram wrote: Sorry it took so long for me to reply. With the holidays and all sometimes I just don't get back on. There are quite a few antibiotics you can't take because it could cause problems with the heart. I had one good doctor actually look up in a book what he could prescribe for a bladder infection. The dentist didn't want to take a chance so he was taking a chance I wouldn't get an infection after the root canal (luckily I didn't). Then one doctor that didn't pay attention and prescribed an antibiotics that after I looked it up I shouldn't have taken because of the Herceptin. So I guess it's just a risk if you take certain antibiotics you may have heart problems. My last Echo test was still good after being on Herceptin for over a year now so I guess it didn't do anything to me.
Posts.Title: Now Dental Problems Too!! readeram readeram

Posts.Content: readeram wrote: Anyone else noticed an increase in dental problems since being diagnosed? I need my second root canal in 4 months. This time the Dentist said my crown was loose so an infection got in. I don't know if problem is due to bone loss in mouth even though my bone mets has been in back and leg or lower due to the lower white blood cell count. Before this I went years without any dental problems. Is anyone else having this problem too? It's like someone just wants to heap one more thing on you to see how much you can take. After all the surgeries and ongoing treatment you just don't feel like going through something new besides the additional expense. Ann Dx 8/8/2007, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/0 nodes, ER- Surgery 2/28/2008 Mastectomy: Right Surgery 2/28/2008 Reconstruction (right): Free TRAM flap Dx 5/1/2012, Stage IV, HER2+ Radiation Therapy 6/4/2012 Breast, Bone Targeted Therapy 8/21/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 8/21/2012 Tykerb (lapatinib) Radiation Therapy 10/10/2012 Bone Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Now Dental Problems Too!! readeram readeram

Posts.Content: readeram wrote: I've had 3 surgeries in the last 3 months trying to remove all the DCIS. The last 2 in just the last 2 weeks due to the Rads Dr deciding to do a post surgery mammo and then finding more DCIS. Now after 2 more surgeries I was just informed me that they are not getting clear margins and I need a simple mastectomy instead of radiation. The nurse stated that it is still an outpatient procedure and I could go back to work in a couple of days and do breast reconstruction at a later date. Has anyone had a simple mastectomy and had breast reconstruction done? My first reaction was yes, let's just get the mastectomy over with. Now I'm not for sure if I will lose some of my options if I don't even talk to a plastic surgeon first. The nurse seem to think it would take months to first get insurance approval, then an appt and then if I want it at the same time to line up both Dr's schedules. I'm not even for sure if I want breast reconstruction because it seems like a lot more surgeries and time off work. I just so confused at this point and don't know what to do. Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2007 04:47PM readeram wrote: I just found out that I will be having a second surgery also. I have DCIS and the post surgery mammo found a "scattering of cells". I don't know much of the details yet as I have my meeting with the surgeon on Monday. The Rads Onc is the one who informed me. I too am wondering if they just cut over the same area or what will happen. My first surgery the cut was 5-1/2" long. I was all geared for the rads treatment and now had to cancel all those appts and deal with surgery again. Sorry, I can't answer your question but good luck on your surgery tomorrow.
Posts.Title: 2nd surgery after lumpectomy jaxmos jeanettee

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2013 05:47PM readeram wrote: Thanks for the replies. I hate that others have to go thru this too but its nice knowing what is causing the problem. I met a guy yesterday at the Imaging Center with different cancer and he said he had a lot of dental problems too. Someone needs to give us a break. At least I talked my dentist in to a 20% discount but he should have given more knowing what I going thru. Everyone have a Happy Thanksgiving.
Posts.Title: Now Dental Problems Too!! readeram readeram

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 02:23PM readeram wrote: Hope you are feeling better now. I didn't have any pain and didn't use the pain pills the dentist gave me. He decided not go give me antibiotics though because I informed him he needed to check which ones I could take as not all of them I can take anymore due to the Herceptin or Tykerb so he decided not to risk it.
Posts.Title: Now Dental Problems Too!! readeram readeram

Posts.Content: readeram wrote: My Rads Onc said I needed a post surgery mammo since one of my margins was close. I had that done on Tuesday and the Dr said he still saw a scattering of DCIS but not in one area where there is an easy answer for surgery. He said his office or my Doctor would call the following day and let me know what they recommend. Of course I haven't heard back yet. I called on Thursday and the Nurse at my Rads Onc said they didn't have the test results yet. Called again today and of course no one was working today. Based on anyone's previous experience do you think they are going to now cancel my Rads appt due for sims on Thursday or can Rads kill the scattering of DCIS?
